entry.title: 543: Profoundly Prophetic Prognostications
entry.summary: We make our big Linux predictions for 2024, but first, we score how we did for 2023. Special Guest: Michael Tunnell.

entry.title: 550: Buff Uncle Jeff
entry.summary: We reflect on how our work has changed over the last year and get some sage advice from buff Uncle Jeff.

entry.title: 542: 2023 Tuxies
entry.summary: Itâ€™s the fourth annual Unplugged Tuxies; our community votes on the best projects, distros, and desktops of 2023.

entry.title: 549: Hacking The Gathering
entry.summary: The clever way one developer hacked an online game, why we're not buying the latest round of cyber war fear, and we finally have our Babylon 5 vs Star Trek debate.

entry.title: 541: Out with a Bang
entry.summary: The stories that kept us talking all year, and are only getting hotter! Plus the big flops we're still sore about. Special Guest: Kenji Berthold.

entry.title: 548: Don't Fight the Music
entry.summary: The fantastic opportunity Google is letting slip through its hands, and why Apple might win the consumer LLM race.

entry.title: 540: Uncensored AI on Linux
entry.summary: We test two popular methods to run local language models on your Linux box. Then, we push the limits to see which language models will toe the line and which won't.

entry.title: 547: The Slow and the Infuriating
entry.summary: After years of resistance, Mike finally surrenders to Xcode. And the secret Apple envy leaked to the public this week.

entry.title: 539: Rollback Required
entry.summary: This week, our embarrassment is your entertainment. Then, we check the age and health of all our disks with one app.
